title: 'Nobody is getting off the hook' Trump says of tariffs
description: A Trump administration official said Sunday that tariff exemptions on cell phones and other electronic devices are only temporary, adding to an already confusing situation around the United States' economic policy.
content:
Secretary of Commerce Howard Lutnick speaks with reporters outside the White House in Washington, DC, in March. Lutnick said Sunday that trade tariffs 'are not up for negotiation.' Photo by Yuri Gripas/UPI | License Photo
April 13 (UPI) -- A Trump ad... [1818 chars]

title: US stock futures rise amid temporary tariff exemptions for tech products
description: Stock futures rose Sunday after a temporary reprieve from tariffs on electronic imports from China by the Trump administration.
content:
CNN —
Stock futures rose Sunday after a temporary reprieve from tariffs on electronic imports from China by the Trump administration.
Dow futures were up 0.5%, or 212 points. The S&P 500 futures rose 0.75%, while the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite futur... [2340 chars]

title: Trump says there are no exemptions from new tariffs
description: Trump said those tech products — which include smartphones, electronic parts, and computer monitors — have merely moved to a "different Tariff 'bucket.'"
content:
President Donald Trump clarified that no products are exempt from his new increased tariffs on China even after Customs and Border Protection announced exemptions for various tech products just last week.
In a Truth Social post on Sunday, Trump said ... [1587 chars]

title: Trump Adds Tariff Exemptions for Smartphones, Computers and Other Electronics
description: A long list of electronic products got a reprieve for now from at least some of the levies on China, which had been expected to take a toll on tech giants like Apple.
content: After more than a week of ratcheting up tariffs on products imported from China, the Trump administration issued a rule late Friday that spared smartphones, computers, semiconductors and other electronics from some of the fees, in a significant break... [1417 chars]

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.

WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters.

content:
President Donald Trump clarified that no products are exempt from his new increased tariffs on China even after Customs and Border Protection announced exemptions for various tech products just last week.
In a Truth Social post on Sunday, Trump said ... [1587 chars]

description: The US has given Apple’s iPhones and other electronic imports an escape hatch from its trade war. Given India’s manufacturing rivalry with China, Trump’s tariff exemption is notable in more than one way.

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.
content:
WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters.

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.

WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters.

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.
content:
WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters.
The prospec... [1244 chars]

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.

WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters.

CNN —
Stock futures rose Sunday after a temporary reprieve from tariffs on electronic imports from China by the Trump administration.
Dow futures were up 0.5%, or 212 points. The S&P 500 futures rose 0.75%, while the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite futur... [2340 chars]

title: Trump says there are no exemptions from new tariffs
description: Trump said those tech products — which include smartphones, electronic parts, and computer monitors — have merely moved to a "different Tariff 'bucket.'"
content:
President Donald Trump clarified that no products are exempt from his new increased tariffs on China even after Customs and Border Protection announced exemptions for various tech products just last week.
In a Truth Social post on Sunday, Trump said ... [1587 chars]

title: Mint Quick Edit | ‘Apple carve-out’ lessons for India
description: The US has given Apple’s iPhones and other electronic imports an escape hatch from its trade war. Given India’s manufacturing rivalry with China, Trump’s tariff exemption is notable in more than one way.
content: In the latest tariff war twist, the US exempted several products, including smartphones and computers, from its reciprocal levies. Among Big Tech beneficiaries in America, it comes as terra-byte-sized relief for Apple, which had a carve-out even from... [957 chars]

title: Trump Adds Tariff Exemptions for Smartphones, Computers and Other Electronics
description: A long list of electronic products got a reprieve for now from at least some of the levies on China, which had been expected to take a toll on tech giants like Apple.
content: After more than a week of ratcheting up tariffs on products imported from China, the Trump administration issued a rule late Friday that spared smartphones, computers, semiconductors and other electronics from some of the fees, in a significant break... [1417 chars]

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.
content:
WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters.
The prospec... [1244 chars]

content: In the latest tariff war twist, the US exempted several products, including smartphones and computers, from its reciprocal levies. Among Big Tech beneficiaries in America, it comes as terra-byte-sized relief for Apple, which had a carve-out even from... [957 chars]

title: Trump Adds Tariff Exemptions for Smartphones, Computers and Other Electronics
description: A long list of electronic products got a reprieve for now from at least some of the levies on China, which had been expected to take a toll on tech giants like Apple.
content: After more than a week of ratcheting up tariffs on products imported from China, the Trump administration issued a rule late Friday that spared smartphones, computers, semiconductors and other electronics from some of the fees, in a significant break... [1417 chars]

title: Why India’s electronics sector is least at risk from Trump's reciprocal tariff scrutiny

content:

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.
content:
WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters.
The prospec... [1244 chars]

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.
content:
WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters.
The prospec... [1244 chars]

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.

WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters.

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.
content:
WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters.

content: In the latest tariff war twist, the US exempted several products, including smartphones and computers, from its reciprocal levies. Among Big Tech beneficiaries in America, it comes as terra-byte-sized relief for Apple, which had a carve-out even from... [957 chars]

title: Trump Adds Tariff Exemptions for Smartphones, Computers and Other Electronics
description: A long list of electronic products got a reprieve for now from at least some of the levies on China, which had been expected to take a toll on tech giants like Apple.
content: After more than a week of ratcheting up tariffs on products imported from China, the Trump administration issued a rule late Friday that spared smartphones, computers, semiconductors and other electronics from some of the fees, in a significant break... [1417 chars]

title: Why India’s electronics sector is least at risk from Trump's reciprocal tariff scrutiny

content:

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.
content:
WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters.
The prospec... [1244 chars]

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.
content:
WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters.
The prospec... [1244 chars]

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.

WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters.

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.
content:
WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters.

content: In the latest tariff war twist, the US exempted several products, including smartphones and computers, from its reciprocal levies. Among Big Tech beneficiaries in America, it comes as terra-byte-sized relief for Apple, which had a carve-out even from... [957 chars]

title: Trump Adds Tariff Exemptions for Smartphones, Computers and Other Electronics
description: A long list of electronic products got a reprieve for now from at least some of the levies on China, which had been expected to take a toll on tech giants like Apple.
content: After more than a week of ratcheting up tariffs on products imported from China, the Trump administration issued a rule late Friday that spared smartphones, computers, semiconductors and other electronics from some of the fees, in a significant break... [1417 chars]

title: Why India’s electronics sector is least at risk from Trump's reciprocal tariff scrutiny

content:

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.
content:
WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters.
The prospec... [1244 chars]

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.
content:
WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters.
The prospec... [1244 chars]

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.

WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters.

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.
content:
WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters.

content: In the latest tariff war twist, the US exempted several products, including smartphones and computers, from its reciprocal levies. Among Big Tech beneficiaries in America, it comes as terra-byte-sized relief for Apple, which had a carve-out even from... [957 chars]

title: Trump Adds Tariff Exemptions for Smartphones, Computers and Other Electronics
description: A long list of electronic products got a reprieve for now from at least some of the levies on China, which had been expected to take a toll on tech giants like Apple.
content: After more than a week of ratcheting up tariffs on products imported from China, the Trump administration issued a rule late Friday that spared smartphones, computers, semiconductors and other electronics from some of the fees, in a significant break... [1417 chars]

title: Why India’s electronics sector is least at risk from Trump's reciprocal tariff scrutiny

content:

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.
content:
WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters.
The prospec... [1244 chars]

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.
content:
WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters.
The prospec... [1244 chars]

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.

WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters.

title: WTO provisionally agrees to extend e-commerce tariff moratorium - sources
description: WTO members reached a provisional deal on Thursday to extend a moratorium on applying duties to electronic transmissions until the next ministerial meeting, likely to be in 2023, two trade sources involved in the discussions told Reuters. The prospect of ending the moratorium, which has exempted data flows from cross-border tariffs since 1998, had raised major concerns among businesses.
